args: Cleo will be happy to hear that.
By the way, Ieyasu, what do you want\nto do today? You said you came here\nto learn things, right?
I did indeed. Perhaps we might start by\nlooking at surrounding towns and villages.
I didn't have much time to do so over the\nnew year, you see.
I'm happy to play tour guide in that case.
Let's go to a village that's new to you.
You have my gratitude.\nThis is truly a beautiful country.
I'm happy to hear you say that. Still,\nI wish you could have seen it before the\nwar; that was Alberia at its finest.
I suppose you'll just have to wait until\nI put the country back together again.
I will do everything in my power to\nhelp you realize that day.
Thank you. That's very encouraging.\n...Hmm? Why is that person sitting\non the ground over there?
Pardon me, sir. Are you injured?
I think I sprained my leg...\nEr, but who are you?
My name is Ieyasu, and I am a traveling\nwarrior from the land of Hinomoto.
Why don't you let us help you home?
Oh no! I couldn't possibly impose on\na pair of weary travelers.
We won't hear of leaving you by the side\nof the road, sir! Now climb on my back.
W-well, I suppose if you insist...
Thank you so much for seeing me home.
I am lucky to have met such kind and\ngenerous people. Thank you again.
I attempted to put weight on my leg, but...\nWell, as you can see, it was a poor idea.
Do you have family here with you?
It's naught but me, I fear.
I know I asked you to show me around\nyour lands, {player_name}, but...
Well, would you mind overmuch if we\nstayed here and tended to this man?
I was going to suggest the same thing.
Is that acceptable to you, sir?
Thank you for humoring my selfishness,\n{player_name}.
Apologies again for the change of plans.
You don't have to apologize.\nI wanted to help.
You're a truly kind person, Ieyasu.\nYou thought only of helping that man,\nno matter the cost to yourself.
Kind? Oh no. All that I do,\nI do for selfish reasons.
Do you remember how we of the\nWyrmclans—the candidates to be future\nrulers of Hinomoto—have such short lives?
Because you made a soulpact to gain\nthe power of a dragon.
Just so. We use our own souls as a\nmedium—essentially giving up our lives\nin order to wield a dragon's power.
Because of that, we are burdened with the\nfate of a short life. I carry this burden,\nas did my father before me.
Your father also had a soulpact?
He did—which is why I carried on his\nlegacy and forged one myself.
I've heard this is why my father left the\nworld when I was but a child.
I see...\nI'm sorry; I didn't mean to make you\nkeep talking about it.
My apologies. I did not mean to\ncause you any distress.
After all, if I am not sad about it,\nthere is no reason for you to be.
Oh, I was sad at the time, of course.\nBut my feelings have moved on.
My father knew he did not have long,\nso he treated me with great affection.
It was the same love he showed to\nall his people, in fact.
In this way, he left the world without\nregret, and allowed those who stayed\nbehind to face an optimistic future.
Your father sounds like he was a\nwonderful man.
I am proud to be his son—even though\nI was never able to return the love my\nfather showed for me in full.
Helping that elderly gentleman, however,\nmakes me feel like I'm doing for him\nwhat I could not do for my own kin.
That is why I called it selfish.
The old man didn't think it was selfish.
And even if it came from a selfish place,\nthe fact that you reached out to help\nsomeone in need still makes it a kind act.
Now then, I suppose we should\nbe getting back at some point.
(The Wyrmclan leaders forge soulpacts\nwith dragons, cursing themselves to\nlive shortened lives...)
(How did they come to take on such a\nrole?)
